item.title: Best Sega Games Available On PlayStation 5, Ranked
item.description: Whether they’re console exclusives, multi-format releases, made by studios directly under Sega, or games just published by the company, these are the best Sega games on the PlayStation 5.

item.title: New York Times Connections: Hints and Answers for #665 April 6, 2025
item.description:
Connections is a daily word puzzle game that is made by the puzzle professionals over at the New York Times Games. In order to win this one, you will need to study each word and attempt to put all sixteen of them into four secret categories.

Since you don't get very many mistakes in this challenging puzzle game, it's easy to get stuck without a clue. But this article is designed to help you a little or a lot, depending on what you want to see. The paragraphs below contain everything from general puzzle hints to the full answer of today's puzzle.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #665 for April 6, 2025

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Trash, Pizza, Cable, Remote, Cool, Water, Hip, Resistance, Current, Spike Lee, Dovetail, Gas, Reserved, Voltage, Distant, and Charge.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

In the sections below, you will find a selection of different helpful tips and spoilers to help you get through this browser-based puzzle game with a win. In order to look at each one, you just need to press the "Read More" button below the header of the item you wish to see.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow NYT Connections Category Hints

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green NYT Connections Category Hints

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue NYT Connections Category Hints

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Purple NYT Connections Category Hints

Purple Connections Category Answer

Purple Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #665 for April 6, 2025

If you want to see the whole spoiler for this popular puzzle game, check out the expandable section below. Inside will be the full answer for today's puzzle, so don't open it up if you aren't prepared to have it completely given away.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Adin Ross Reveals How Much He Makes from Kick Streams
item.description:
Summary

  • Kick streamers earn by the hour: $10 with 50 viewers, $100 with 1,000 viewers. Adin Ross made $27k in 5 hours.
  • Sam Frank made $80,000 with 3,500 viewers, no subs. Kick's payout model appeals to creators.
  • Viewers on Kick may soon earn money for watching streams. Unclear details; potential to pressure Twitch.

Popular streamer Adin Ross just shared the details on how much money he’s making streaming on Kick, Twitch ’s big rival, showing off the huge numbers he earns from just one session. Kick entered the livestreaming world in late 2022 and quickly grew, signing top talent, including some of Twitch’s biggest names, and establishing itself as a serious contender.

Twitch has stayed the leader in livestreaming for years, while other challengers like Mixer and Facebook Gaming couldn’t last. Kick, though, went against what many expected after early predictions said it’d fail fast. The platform built its plan around two key things: less strict content moderation than Twitch and better payouts for streamers. Kick also signed several high-profile content creators with lucrative contracts to pull in viewers and grow quickly. Adin Ross was one of the first big names to switch, joining Kick in February 2023.

Adin Ross, who’s been with Kick for over two years, just broke down how much he’s earning on the platform during a recent stream. He explained that even without subscriptions, the Kick Partner Program keeps the cash coming, and any streamer can make solid earnings. Adin laid it out: 1,000 viewers means about $100 an hour, while 50 viewers nets around $10 an hour. To show what that looks like, he pointed to his April 1 stream, where he teamed up with xQc and Sneako for just under five hours and earned $27,169. Talking to new streamers, Adin said Kick makes growing fast and easy, adding, “I streamed for five hours and made 30 grand.”

Adin Ross Reveals Kick Earnings

Another Kick streamer, Sam Frank, recently shared her own numbers, saying she made $80,000 in her best month. She averaged 3,500 viewers, streaming nearly 15 hours a day for almost a month, and said, “Kick literally changed my life.” These figures show how much Kick is paying its creators, and not needing subscribers to earn stands out as a big advantage. That setup’s likely driving Kick’s rise, maybe even pushing Twitch to improve its own partner program.

Adin Ross also shared that Kick’s planning new features to let viewers earn money by watching streams. This isn’t the first time he’s mentioned these plans - back in October, he said Kick was developing a new currency to reward viewers for tuning in. The details are still unclear, like how much the currency’s worth, how often viewers can earn it, or what the cash-out limit will be, and there’s no word on when this program will launch either.

item.title: 7 Best Open-World Games With Secret Endings, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games offer immersive experiences with hidden secrets and various endings.
  • Titles like Fallout: New Vegas, Cyberpunk 2077, and Red Dead Redemption 2 have unique secret endings.
  • Players can unlock different conclusions by teaming up with specific characters or choosing unique dialogue options.

Open-world games are simply fantastic due to all the wonderful options they offer players. Since they're typically so vast, developers have to pack into them as much as possible, including side missions, companions, and even large dialog trees. While many AAA titles have multi-million-dollar budgets, there are also some immersive indie open-world games that are great fun.

In most cases, open/world games have tons of secrets hidden away in their world, which can be discovered through the use of readable in-game books and other elements. Here are some of the best open-world games with secret endings that many have missed .

7 Fallout: New Vegas

The Dead Money DLC Has A Secret Ending

  • Teaming up with Father Elijah unlocks a secret ending
  • Various mods are available to improve the gaming experience

Fallout: New Vegas is considered by many players to be one of the best installments in its series. While it doesn't have the graphics or game mechanics that Fallout 4 does, it still manages to deliver a very enjoyable experience to players.

In the Dead Money DLC, players can choose to team up with Father Elijah, use the cloud and holograms, and wipe out everyone in Mojave. This provides a very interesting conclusion to the game, quite different to any other ending present in the game. Players looking to improve their experience might want to try some of the best mods for immersion in Fallout: New Vegas .

6 Far Cry 4

Waiting For Pagan Min Provides A Secret Early Ending

  • Players can wait for Pagan Min to return to the room where they're eating
  • The Himalayan setting is beautiful

The Far Cry franchise has been around for years at the time of writing this article, and throughout the years, several great titles have been released in it. Far Cry 4 is not the exception, thanks to its interesting game mechanics and the beautiful Himalayan environment it’s set in.

In the early stages of the game, players will be left in a room to eat at after they meet Pagan Min. If they can wait for 15 minutes, Min will return to the room and tell Ajay about his mother. This ending implies that Ajay teams up with Pagan Min against those who would alternatively be his allies. Far Cry 4 also offers tons of Easter eggs that are easy to miss.

5 Cyberpunk 2077

Choosing A Specific Dialogue In "Chippin' In" Unlocks A Secret Ending

  • An outstanding title set in a dystopian future run by evil corporations
  • Players must choose the right words to get a secret ending

Cyberpunk 2077 is one of the best games set in a futuristic dystopian society that's ever been released. Not only does the game look amazing, but there are tons of main and side quests that players can get from the various NPCs spread across Night City.

There is a secret variation of the Sun ending, where V and Johnny Silverhand storm Arasaka Tower together. To get this ending, players will have to follow a specific line of dialogue in the Chippin’ In quest, so it can be easily missed if the wrong words are chosen.

4 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

With 36 Different Possible Endings, There Are Many Secrets To Uncover

  • Playing Gwent can be great fun
  • Several possible endings

Although it was released way back in 2015, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt remains, to this day, a masterpiece that both fans of the franchise and lovers of RPGs set in fantasy worlds still return to frequently.

There are many interesting things to do in The Witcher 3 , including monster Contracts and side missions. The game has a total of 36 different endings, so even the most dedicated of players will likely have missed one or two. Some of them are quite tragic, whereas in others, everything turns out well. Playing Gwent in The Continent is also quite fun, so those interested might want to learn about all the Gwent decks available in The Witcher 3 to increase their chances of success.

3 Elden Ring

Ranni's Age Of Stars Ending Is Very Interesting

  • A Dark Souls feeling with open-world mechanics
  • Ranni's Age of Stars' ending is hard to get

Elden Ring is everything that made the Dark Souls franchise great, and also everything it wishes it could have been back in the day. The beautiful open world it presents to players is full of interesting things to discover and dangerous enemies to take on.

There are several possible endings for this game, including Ranni's Age of Stars, which is, arguably, one of the hardest to get and the rarest as well. To get this ending, it’s important that players defeat Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon , complete Ranni the Witch 's questline, give her the Dark Moon Ring and finally summon her after defeating the Elden Beast . Those who are looking to level up fast might want to check out some of the bosses that drop the most Runes in Elden Ring .

2 Red Dead Redemption 2

Many Players Are Not Aware That Arthur's Honor Level Can Determine The Ending

  • Four different endings
  • Honor level matters in determining the outcome

As far as games set in the American Wild West go, there's no doubt or question that Red Dead Redemption 2 is at the top of the list. Arthur Morgan is an extremely likable character, and so are many of the NPCs that he can interact with throughout the story.

This title features various game mechanics, including the Dead Eye shooting mode and hunting, for which there are many great weapons. There are four different endings in Red Dead Redemption 2 and some of them are greatly determined by Arthur’s Honor level.

1 Grand Theft Auto 5

Killing Devin Weston Is An Option, But Turning On Friends Can Also Be The Alternative

  • Players can choose to kill Trevor or Michael
  • Not a secret ending per se, but an interesting one nonetheless

Grand Theft Auto 5 is, unquestionably, one of the most popular games of the last 30 years, and it has made Rockstar Games millions of dollars throughout its lifespan. This title not only has amazing shooting and driving mechanics, but the story is compelling and the main characters are extremely likable.

Although some players argue that it's not a “secret” ending per se, it's possible to kill Devin Weston and also either Michael or Trevor at the end of the story. There’s no option to kill Franklin, but even then, it’s quite interesting. Those looking to shake up their second Grand Theft Auto playthrough will definitely want to try some of the most entertaining options out there.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Making Changes to Armor Plate
item.description:
Summary

  • Warzone is making changes to the Armor Plate system to improve player experience.
  • The return of Verdansk brought back familiar issues like armor plate scarcity.
  • Developers are responsive to feedback and plan to adjust equipment distribution.

Call of Duty: Warzone has announced upcoming changes to the armor plate system. This update comes alongside the highly anticipated return of Verdansk, the original and iconic Call of Duty: Warzone map, to the battle royale experience.

After a long wait, Verdansk has finally returned to Warzone with the Season 3 update, bringing a wave of updates along with reintroduced content and features aimed at recapturing the feel of the original 2020 version of Activision’s free-to-play title. The goal was to deliver an experience as close as possible to what players remember from the game’s early days. However, the return also revived some of the issues present in the original release – such as the shortage of armor plates. Just like before, though, these problems are expected to be addressed through upcoming fixes.

In a recent tweet, Call of Duty: Warzone developer Raven Software announced that the team is working on adjusting armor plate distribution in the game. The developer also confirmed that it has “collected a massive amount of launch feedback” on various aspects of the game, which it is using to improve both the Verdansk experience and Warzone overall.

Call of Duty: Warzone Devs Set to Apply Player Feedback to Improve Verdansk Experience

To bring Warzone closer to the original, more streamlined experience, the developers implemented several changes, such as limiting the number of armor plates, currency, and other useful items available on the map. These restrictions marked a significant shift from previous versions of the game. However, after testing these adjustments and gathering feedback from the community, it became clear that in-game performance and player satisfaction didn’t meet expectations. In response, Raven Software has expressed a willingness to tweak the availability and distribution of equipment – especially armor plates – to ensure players have the resources they need to fully enjoy the battle royale experience.

It’s encouraging to see the game's development team open to adjusting their decisions based on how changes play out in-game, giving players a chance to test them and providing feedback that helps refine the Warzone experience – especially with Verdansk now back online. This isn’t the first time Raven Software has fine-tuned gameplay mechanics to ensure a fun, competitive, and balanced experience. While this often involves a period of live testing with active player participation, the team has consistently shown it is responsive and willing to adapt. Ultimately, the goal is to ensure that Verdansk’s return is meaningful and sustainable, backed by a solid foundation and continued support through fresh content and thoughtful updates.
